sen.j: 伊勢大輔（いせのたいふ／いせのおおすけ、永祚 (日本)元年（989年）頃？ - 康平3年（1060年）頃？）は平安時代中期の女流歌人。
sen.e: ISE no Taifu (Osuke), ca. 989 - ca. 1060, was a lady poet in the mid-Heian period.
ISE no Taifu (Osuke), ca. 989 - ca. 1060, was a lady poet in the mid-Heian period.
ISE no Taifu (also known as Osuke) (ca. 989 - ca. 1060) was a lady poet in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: also known as補足日付表記

sen.e: Her father was ONAKATOMI no Sukechika.
Her father was ONAKATOMI no Sukechika.
Her father was ONAKATOMI no Sukechika.

sen.j: 高階成能に嫁し、康資王母、筑前乳母、源兼俊母など優れた歌人を生んだ。
sen.e: Married to TAKASHINA no Shigeyoshi, she bore great poets like Prince Yasusuke's mother, CHIKUZEN no Menoto and MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi's mother.
sen.cmt: 高階成能の読み方不明→「よししげ」では？田口成能に準じました(訳者）高階成順（Narinobu Takashina）と結婚したとするサイトもあります。筑前乳母の読み方不明
sen.e: Married to TAKASHINA no Shigeyoshi, she bore great poets like Prince Yasusuke's mother, CHIKUZEN no Menoto and MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi's mother.
Married to TAKASHINA no Shigeyoshi, she bore great poets like Prince Yasusuke's mother, CHIKUZEN no Menoto and MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi's mother.

sen.j: 中古三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: She was one of the Medieval Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.
She was one of the Medieval Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.
She was regarded as one of the medieval 36 Immortal Poets.

sen.j: 1008年（寛弘5年）頃に一条天皇の中宮上東門院藤原彰子に仕えた。
sen.e: Around 1008 she served Jyotomon'in FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Akiko), Imperial Consort of Emperor Ichijo. She made friends with Izumi SHIKIBU and Murasaki SHIKIBU at court. In her later years she served as the nurse of Emperor Shirakawa.
sen.cmt: 晩年とあるので「傅育」は必ずしもwet nurseではないと思われます。ここはたんにnurseとしました。
sen.e: Around 1008 she served Jyotomon'in FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Akiko), Imperial Consort of Emperor Ichijo. She made friends with Izumi SHIKIBU and Murasaki SHIKIBU at court. In her later years she served as the nurse of Emperor Shirakawa.
Around 1008 she served Jotomonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi (also known as Akiko), Imperial Consort of Emperor Ichijo.
sen.cmt: also known as補足一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 和泉式部・紫式部などと親交した。
sen.e: She made friends with Izumi SHIKIBU and Murasaki SHIKIBU at court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 晩年には白河天皇の傅育の任にあたった。
sen.e: In her later years she served as the nurse of Emperor Shirakawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 1060年（康平3年）までの生存が確認されている。
sen.e: It has been confirmed that she did not die before 1060.
It has been confirmed that she did not die before 1060.
It has been confirmed that she did not die before 1060.

sen.j: 1049年（永承4年）の内裏歌合、1056年（天喜4年）の皇后宮寛子春秋歌合に出詠している。
sen.e: She submitted her verses in the Court Poetic Contest in 1049 and the Spring and Autumn Poetry Contest held by Empress Kanshi (Hiroko) in 1056.
She submitted her verses in the Court Poetry Contest in 1049 and the Spring and Autumn Poetry Contest held by Empress Kanshi (Hiroko) in 1056.
She submitted her verses in the Court Poetry Contest in 1049 and the Spring and Autumn Poetry Contest held by Empress Kanshi (also known as Hiroko) in 1056.

sen.j: 「後拾遺和歌集」以下の勅撰和歌集に約50集が入集。
sen.e: Some fifty verses of hers were selected in the imperial anthologies from 'Goshui Wakashu' (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) onwards.
Some fifty verses of hers were selected for the imperial anthologies from 'Goshui Wakashu' (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) onwards.
Some fifty verses of hers were selected for the imperial anthologies from 'Goshui Wakashu' (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) onwards.

sen.j: 家集に「伊勢大輔集」がある。
sen.e: She also compiled the private anthology 'ISE no Taifu-shu' (the Selected Verses of ISE no Taifu).
She also compiled the private anthology 'ISE no Taifu-shu' (the Selected Verses of ISE no Taifu).
She also compiled the private anthology 'ISE no Taifu-shu' (the Selected Verses of ISE no Taifu).
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems, One Poem Each)
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems, One Poem Each)
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (the Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)

sen.j: 61番 いにしへの 奈良の都の 八重桜 けふ九重に 匂ひぬるかな （「詞花集」春29）
sen.e: No. 61 Double cherry blossoms from the ancient city of Nara are splendidly blossoming today in the palace in Kyoto. ['Shikashu' (the Collection of Verbal Flowers), Spring 29].
No. 61 Double cherry blossoms from the ancient city of Nara are splendidly blossoming today in the palace in Kyoto. ['Shikashu' (the Collection of Verbal Flowers), Spring 29].
No. 61: Double cherry blossoms from the ancient city of Nara are splendidly blossoming today in the palace in Kyoto. ('Shikashu' (the Collection of Verbal Flowers), Spring 29).
